metadata.title: CVE-2020-18184 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: In PluxXml V5.7,the theme edit function /PluXml/core/admin/parametres_edittpl.php allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP code by placing this code into a template.

notes.note: seth-arnold> I've asked if this is an intentional feature or not; the documentation suggests to me that it is intentional for the administrator to be able to execute arbitrary code. leosilva> deferred as no fix as 2021-10-19.

criterions.comment: pluxml package in hirsute is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2021-10-19').
